description:
A07,Antidiarrheals Intestinal Antiinflammatory/Antiinfective Agents,"
A07A,Intestinal Antiinfectives,Locally acting antiinfectives; for systemic antiinfectives see group J; see also group P for antiparasitic products, insecticides, and repellents.
A07AA,Antibiotics,Oral vancomycin and colistin for enterocolitis are classified here; parenteral forms fall under J01XA and J01XB. Combined products containing neomycin receive classification priority (A07AA51). Paromomycin injection for leishmaniasis is also classified here. DDDs are based on treatment of intestinal infections.
D,Dermatologicals,Topical and systemic preparations with dermatological applications including treatments for acne
column5: and skin infections. Systemic agents with clear dermatological use are also included."

drug_class_name: Antibiotics and chemotherapeutics for dermatological use
description: Products for topical treatment of skin infections. Antimicrobial chemotherapeutics are included; antineoplastic chemotherapeutics are classified in L01.
Antibiotics for dermatological use except those with antimycotic properties, combinations with chemotherapeutics (D06C), corticosteroids (D07C), or anti-acne agents (D10AF).
Topical tetracycline antibiotics. Combined preparations containing oxytetracycline with other antibiotics are classified under D06AA03.
Topical antibiotics not included in other subclasses. Combined neomycin preparations are D06AX04; bacitracin combinations with chlorhexidine or polymyxin B are D06AX05.
ATC group comprising preparations used for genito-urinary therapeutic indications, including some sexes hormone roles.
Gynecological antiinfectives and antiseptics mainly for local use. Excludes combinations with corticosteroids (G01B) and antivirals (classified in D06).
Antibiotics used locally to treat vaginal infections through gynecological administration.

Imidazole derivatives (e.g. metronidazole and ornidazole) in formulations for vaginal administration are classified in this group. Parenteral formulations are classified in J01XD, as they are mainly used in anaerobic infections. Imidazole derivatives in oral (including tablets used for the treatment of gynecological infections only) and rectal dosage forms are classified in P01AB. Metronidazole for topical use in skin disorders is classified in D06BX - Other chemotherapeutics.
Fluconazole tablets in single dose packages, only for gynecological infections, are classified together with other packages for systemic use in J02A - Antimycotics for systemic use.
Nifuratel in combination with nystatin is classified in G01AA51.
This group comprises tetracycline antibacterials inhibiting the bacterial protein synthesis through binding to the 30-S part of ribosomes.
This group comprises amphenicol antibacterials inhibiting the bacterial protein synthesis. Thiamphenicol acetylcysteinate glycinate for inhalation is classified in J01BA52.

This group comprises penicillin beta-lactam antibacterials inhibiting the bacterial cell wall synthesis. Combinations of penicillins from different 4th levels including beta-lactamase inhibitors are classified in J01CR.
This group comprises penicillins with enhanced activity against gram negative rods, e.g. ampicillin and similar antibiotics.

drug_class_name: Combinations of penicillins incl. beta-lactamase inhibitors
description: This group comprises combinations of penicillins, including combinations of penicillins with beta-lactamase inhibitors. Combinations containing one penicillin and enzyme inhibitor are classified at different 5th levels according to the penicillin.
The first generation compounds have relatively narrow spectrum of activity focused primarily on the gram-positive cocci.

The second generation cephalosporins have a variable activity against gram-positive cocci but have increased activity against gram-negative bacteria. The cephamycin group is included in the second-generation cephalosporins.
The third generation cephalosporins have a marked activity against gram-negative bacteria. Limited activity against gram-positive cocci particularly methicillin susceptible S. aureus might occur.

The fourth generation cephalosporins have activity against gram-positive cocci and a broad array of gram-negative bacteria including P. aeruginosa and many of the Enterobacteriaceae with inducible chromosomal b-lactamases.
Arginin and lysine salts of aztreonam are classified in J01DF01; thus aztreonam for inhalation is classified together with systemic formulations.
The DDD for meropenem is based on treatment of severe infections.
Î²-lactam antibacterials distinct from classic cephalosporin generations; includes ceftolozane combinations
The DDDs are based on the treatment of acute urinary-tract infections.
This group comprises sulfonamides with a biological half-life not exceeding approx. 7 hours.
This group comprises sulfonamides with a biological half-life of approx. 11-12 hours.
This group comprises sulfonamides with a biological half-life of approx. 35 hours or more.

drug_class_name: Combinations of sulfonamides and trimethoprim incl. derivatives
description: When establishing DDDs for combination products both components are taken into consideration see list of DDDs for combination products atcddd.fhi.no.

Erythromycin ethylsuccinate tablets have been assigned a higher DDD than other preparations of erythromycin due to a lower bio-availability. This DDD is mainly based on the dose recommendations. The oral DDD for azithromycin is based on a 5-day regimen.
Orally and parenterally administered clindamycin have different DDDs due to different indications i.e. the intestinal and systemic infections respectively.

The streptogramin components dalfopristin/quinupristin are semisynthetic derivatives of pristinamycin. The two components have synergistic antibacterial effect and are always used together. Quinupristin/dalfopristin are therefore classified at the ATC plain level J01FG02.
Streptomycins in combination with antimycobacterials are classified in J04AM.
Tobramycin and amikacin for inhalation are classified together with the systemic formulations in J01GB01 and J01GB06 respectively.
Flumequine is classified in J01MB. Alalevonadifloxacin is classified in J01MA24 together with levonadifloxacin.
Preparations which in addition contain a urine acidifier such as vitamin C calcium- or ammonium chloride are classified at the plain 5th levels.
Combinations of urinary antiseptics and antiinfectives are classified in J01RA02.

This group comprises glycopeptide antibacterials inhibiting the cell wall synthesis of gram positive bacteria. Lipoglycopeptide antibacterials are also included in this group. Teicoplanin and intravenous preparations of vancomycin are classified in this group. Oral formulations containing vancomycin are classified in A07A.
This group comprises polymyxin antibacterials acting on the bacterial cytoplasm membrane. Oral formulations containing colistin are classified in A07A.
This group comprises steroid antibacterials inhibiting the binding of bacterial transfer-RNA and the 50-S part of the ribosomes.
This group comprises imidazole antibacterials acting through active metabolites in anaerobic bacteria.
Preparations which in addition contain a urine acidifier such as vitamin C calcium- or ammonium chloride are classified at the plain 5th levels.
Preparations which in addition contain a urine acidifier such as vitamin C calcium- or ammonium chloride are classified at the plain 5th levels.

This group comprises drugs mainly used for the treatment of tuberculosis or lepra. However, streptomycins are classified in J01G - Aminoglycoside antibacterials. Streptomycin in combination with antimycobacterials are classified in J04AM.
Drugs used in the treatment of tuberculosis derived from aminosalicylic acid, typically second-line agents.
Antibiotics specifically indicated for the treatment of tuberculosis, excluding rifamycins classified elsewhere.
Tuberculosis drugs based on hydrazide chemical structures, including isoniazid and related agents.
Thiocarbamide-derived tuberculosis medications used as second-line therapy.

drug_class_name: Other drugs for treatment of tuberculosis
description: Antituberculosis drugs not fitting into other chemical subgroups, often used in resistant cases.

drug_class_name: Combinations of drugs for treatment of tuberculosis
description: Fixed-dose combination products containing multiple antituberculosis agents to improve adherence and reduce resistance.
Thalidomide, which is also used for treatment of lepra, is classified in L04AX.
This group comprises preparations used in the treatment of neoplastic diseases, and immunomodulating agents.
Combination products are classified in L01XY - Combinations of antineoplastic agents, except for combinations of monoclonal antibodies or antibody drug conjugates which are classified in L01FY.
Antineoplastic agents derived from or related to antibiotic structures. Used in cancer therapy.
Includes mitomycin (also used in glaucoma surgery).
Insecticides and Repellents
column4: Products used for treatment and prevention of parasitic infestations and for repelling insects.

description: Agents used in the treatment of protozoal infections.

drug_class_name: Agents Against Amoebiasis and Other Protozoal Diseases
description: Agents used to treat amoebiasis and other infections caused by protozoa.
Drugs used in the prevention and treatment of malaria.
Antimalarial agents belonging to the aminoquinoline class, used to treat and prevent malaria.
Antimalarial compounds from the biguanide class, used to inhibit parasite development.
Antimalarial drugs derived from methanolquinoline structures, used for treatment of malaria infections.
Antimalarial agents that inhibit folate metabolism in parasites through diaminopyrimidine activity.
Plain
column4: Artemisinin-based antimalarial agents used alone for treatment of malaria.

description: Combinations
column4: Artemisinin-based antimalarial agents used in combination therapies to improve efficacy and reduce resistance.

description: Miscellaneous antimalarial agents not classified in other groups.
Agents used to treat parasitic infections caused by leishmania and trypanosoma species.
This group comprises drugs used to treat infections affecting the whole body.
This group comprises antibacterial drugs used for systemic treatment of infections.
This group comprises tetracycline antibacterials inhibiting bacterial protein synthesis via the 30S ribosomal subunit.
This group comprises amphenicol antibacterials inhibiting bacterial protein synthesis.
penicillins
column4: This group comprises penicillin beta-lactam antibacterials inhibiting bacterial cell wall synthesis.

description: This group comprises cephalosporins, monobactams, carbapenems, and other beta-lactams not classified as penicillins.
This group comprises sulfonamide antibacterials and their combinations with trimethoprim.
lincosamides
column5: This group comprises macrolide, lincosamide, and streptogramin antibacterials.

description: This group comprises aminoglycoside antibacterials.
This group comprises quinolone and quinoxaline antibacterials.
This group comprises combinations of antibacterial drugs.
This group comprises other antibacterials not classified in previous groups.
This group comprises antibiotics that are used in veterinary medicine, particularly for pigs and poultry, to treat and control infectious diseases
Antibacterial agents administered into the mammary gland to treat mastitis in veterinary medicine.
Intramammary formulations of tetracycline antibiotics used to treat bacterial inflammation in the udder.
Intramammary chloramphenicol-related antibiotics for treating bovine mastitis.
Penicillins
column5: Intramammary penicillin antibiotics used for udder infections in dairy animals.

drug_class_name: Other Beta-lactam Antibacterials for Intramammary Use
description: Non-penicillin beta-lactam antibiotics administered intramammarily to treat mastitis.

drug_class_name: Sulfonamides and Trimethoprim for Intramammary Use
description: Intramammary sulfonamide-based antimicrobials used for bacterial udder infections.

drug_class_name: Macrolides and Lincosamides for Intramammary Use
description: Intramammary macrolide or lincosamide antibiotics used for mastitis therapy.
Intramammary aminoglycosides targeting gram-negative bacteria causing mastitis.

drug_class_name: Combinations of Antibacterials for Intramammary Use
description: Products containing two or more antibacterial agents administered into the udder.
Intramammary antibacterial agents not classified elsewhere within the group.
Inhaled antiinfectives are classified in ATC group J - Antiinfectives for systemic use.
Varenicline nasal spray used for dry eye disease is classified in S01XA.

This group comprises preparations for local treatment in nasal congestion or allergic rhinitis; includes nasal drops, sprays, or inhalants. Formulations approved for eye, ear, and nose are classified in S03.
"Small amounts of antiseptics etc. are allowed at each 5th level. Combinations with antibiotics
column5: ipatropium bromide etc. are classified in R01AB
column6: while combinations with corticosteroids are classified in R01AD."

description: combinations excl. corticosteroids
column4: Combinations with antibiotics, antihistamines, or ipratropium bromide are classified here; includes preparations with two or more sympathomimetics. Combinations are ranked by ATC code order.

description: excl. corticosteroids
column4: Antihistamines, cromoglicate disodium and analogues are classified here. Combinations with corticosteroids are classified in R01AD.

description: Combinations of corticosteroids with antiinfectives, sympathomimetics, antihistamines etc. are classified in this group at separate 5th levels by using the 50-series.
This group comprises antiinfectives, antiseptics, mucolytics etc. which cannot be classified in the preceding groups.
This group comprises preparations for systemic use in vasomotoric or allergic rhinitis etc., excl. plain antihistamines (see R06).
ATC Level 2 therapeutic group
ATC Level 3 pharmacological subgroup
See also A01AB - Antiinfectives and antiseptics for local oral treatment. At each 5th level combinations with anesthetics are allowed.
See also A01AB - Antiinfectives and antiseptics for local oral treatment. Combinations of antibiotics and antiseptics are classified in this group.
This group comprises e.g. throat lozenges containing local anesthetics. Dental anesthetics for local application are classified in N01B - Anesthetics, local.
Combinations of benzydamine and cetylpyridinium are classified at the same 5th level as benzydamine.
Drug group comprising agents used for conditions of the eye, ear, or nose; multi-site formulations may be classified in S03.
Drugs used primarily to treat ocular conditions; includes topical and systemic preparations with clear ophthalmological indications.
Plain and combination antiinfective preparations for ophthalmological use; combinations with corticosteroids are classified in S01CA.
Antibiotic preparations for ophthalmological (eye) use.
Ophthalmic sulfonamide antiinfectives; combinations with antibiotics are classified under S01AA.
Antiviral preparations formulated for ophthalmological use.
Fluoroquinolone antibacterial preparations for ophthalmological use.
Other ophthalmic antiinfective agents not classified elsewhere in S01A.
